title: French (1839) New Testament
description: French (1839) New Testament Antoine Godeau, the Bishop of Grasse, released a French New Testament translation from the Vulgate in 1668, spanning two octavo volumes. Godeau's work is recognized for balancing between a direct translation and paraphrase, offering a unique take on the scriptures. Nicolas Legros later published an anonymous translation in Cologne, 1739, which, when reissued with his name, faced criticism from prominent Catholic figures like Bossuet and Cardinal de Noailles for alleged Socinian tendencies. This edition highlights the complexities of translating sacred texts in a period marked by religious and doctrinal scrutiny.
